title: Marine plastic: a new and growing threat to coral reefs
body: (Image source: Pixabay) Each year, it is estimated that more than 8 million tonnes of plastic are ending up in the oceans - the equivalent of emptying a garbage truck of plastic every minute. We are producing 20 times more plastic today than in the 1960s.
readable_content: - Hello! How can I assist you today?
summary:
The text expresses concern about the impact of plastic straws on the environment and discusses the benefits of banning them. It conveys a positive sentiment towards the idea of banning plastic straws. 
Sentiment: 0.8
